title: How to Remove Saved Places on Google Maps on PC or Mac

steps.title: Go to https://maps.google.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://maps.google.com in a web browser. If you’re not already signed in to your Google account, click Sign In at the top-right corner of the screen to do so now.

steps.title: Click the ≡ menu.
steps.content: Click the ≡ menu. It’s at the top-left corner of the page.

steps.title: Click Your places.
steps.content: Click Your places . It’s in the third set of options. A window will open on the left side of the map.

steps.title: Click the SAVED tab.
steps.content: Click the SAVED tab. It’s at the top of the “Your places” window.

steps.title: Click the category where the place is saved.
steps.content: Click the category where the place is saved. You’ll find your saved location in Favorites , Want to go , or Starred places .

steps.title: Click the location to remove.
steps.content: Click the location to remove. Maps will zoom in and display related information.

steps.title: Click the SAVED flag icon.
steps.content: Click the SAVED flag icon. It’s under the name of the location. A list of categories will expand—the category where the location is saved has a blue and white check mark.

steps.title: Remove the check mark from the category.
steps.content: Remove the check mark from the category. This removes the location from your saved places.
